description.p: Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits

ul.li: Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Choose either the Deception or Performance skill. You gain proficiency in the chosen skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
You have advantage on Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Performance) checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.

You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Deception and Performance checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person. You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Insight check contested by your Deception check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

element.name: Deception
element.description: You gain proficiency in the Deception skill. If you are already proficient in Deception, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

element.name: Performance
element.description: You gain proficiency in the Performance skill. If you are already proficient in Performance, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

element.name: Demonic Mark
element.prerequisite: Kurush, Monk

description.p: The mark on your back has grown in power. Among other things, you learn the Chaos Bolt spell.

p.i: This feat will not be displayed on your sheet. There's a seperate document for what it does, and it's crowded enough as is!

sheet.description: The mark on your back has grown in power.

description.p: Always on the lookout for danger, you gain the folloing benefits:

ul.li: When you roll Initiative, you add your Proficiency bonus to the roll.
You can’t be surprised while you are conscious.
Other creatures don’t gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

sheet.description: You can't be surprised while conscious. Other creatures don’t gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

element.name: Athlete
element.prerequisite: Strength and Dexterity of 13 or higher

description.p: You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
When you are prone, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.
Climbing doesn’t cost you extra movement.
You can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

sheet.description: When you are prone, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement. Climbing doesn’t cost you extra movement. You can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

description.p: You are eager to engage your foes, and know how to add the momentum of your charge to the power of your attack. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line toward a target immediately before hitting it with a melee attack, the attack gains a +5 bonus to damage. In addition, if this attacks hits a target no more than one size larger than you, it must succeed at a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be pushed back 10 feet.

sheet.description: Moving at least 10 feet in a straight line before a melee weapon attack adds +5 damage and forces a target no more than one size larger than you to succeed at a Strength saving throw (DC: {{charger:dc}}) or be pushed back 10 feet.

description.p: Thanks to extensive practice with the crossbow, you gain the following benefits with any crossbow weapon with which you are proficient:

ul.li: Increase one Ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You add your proficiency bonus to damage rolls made with crossbow weapons.

If your attack roll with a crossbow weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to your proficiency bonus. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can’t be increased in any way other than increasing your proficiency bonus.

After you have made an attack with a crossbow weapon, the first attack you make that turn with another weapon against the same target gains advantage. This can be achieved through the Extra Attack class feature, or when attacking with a hand crossbow and another weapon at the same time.

sheet.description: Crossbow attacks deal +{{crossbow:prof}} bonus damage. Missed attacks with crossbows still deal {{crossbow:prof}} damage. After you have made an attack with a crossbow, the first attack you make that turn with another weapon against the same target gains advantage.

description.p: You know how to get your enemies where you want them, and how to keep them there. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Whenever you reduce a creature's speed by 10 feet or more, you can reduce it by an additional 5 feet.
Whenever you push a creature 10 feet or more, you can push them an additional 5 feet.
Once during your turn, when you push a creature 5 feet or more or knock it prone, you can choose for it to also become exposed (-2 to AC and Dexterity Saving Throws) until the start of its next turn.

sheet.description: Whenever you reduce a creature's speed by 10 feet or more, you can reduce it by an additional 5 feet. Whenever you push a creature 10 feet or more, you can push them an additional 5 feet. Once during your turn, when you push a creature at least 5 feet or knock it prone, you can choose for it to become exposed (-2 to AC and Dexterity Saving Throws) until the start of its next turn.

description.p: You are familiar with the back-and-forth of martial combat, and gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

When you are wielding a melee weapon with which you are proficient and another creature no more than one size larger than you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you.
When you make an opportunity attack with a melee weapon with which you are proficient, you have advantage on the attack roll.

sheet.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon and another creature no more than one size larger than you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add {{defensive duelist:ac}} to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you. In addition, when you make an opportunity attack with a melee weapon you have advantage on the attack roll.

description.p: You master fighting with two weapons, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one handed melee weapons you are wielding aren’t light.
If you do choose to use one or more light weapons, you gain a +1 bonus to AC for each light melee weapon you are wielding.
If you have the Extra Attack feature, you can make one additional attack with your second weapon whenever you take the Attack action.

sheet.description: You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one handed melee weapons you are wielding aren’t light. You gain a +1 bonus to AC for each light melee weapon you are wielding. If you have the Extra Attack feature, you can make one additional attack with your second weapon whenever you take the Attack action.

description.p: Alert to the hidden traps and secret doors found in many dungeons, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.
Traps that make attack rolls do so with disadvantage against you.
You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Perception and Investigation checks made to detect the presence of secret doors. You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps. Traps that make attack rolls do so with disadvantage against you. You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

element.name: Survivor
element.prerequisite: Constitution 13 or higher

description.p: You refuse to go down, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, you may double the Constitution modifier that gets added to the roll.
You have advantage on Death Saving throws.

sheet.description: When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, you double the Constitution modifier that gets added to the roll. You have advantage on Death Saving throws.

element.name: Fire Adept
element.prerequisite: The ability to cast at least one spell

description.p: You have mastered the use of fire magic in combat. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Spells you cast ignore resistance to fire damage.
When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, you can add your proficiency bonus to the damage roll. The damage bonus applies to one damage roll of a spell, not multiple rolls.

sheet.description: Spells you cast ignore resistance to fire damage. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, you can add +{{fireadept:prof}} to the damage roll.

element.name: Cold Adept
element.prerequisite: The ability to cast at least one spell

description.p: You have mastered the use of cold magic in combat. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Spells you cast ignore resistance to cold damage.
When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage, you can add your proficiency bonus to the damage roll. The damage bonus applies to one damage roll of a spell, not multiple rolls.

sheet.description: Spells you cast ignore resistance to cold damage. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage, you can add +{{coldadept:prof}} to the damage roll.

element.name: Storm Adept
element.prerequisite: The ability to cast at least one spell

description.p: You have mastered the use of lightning and thunder magic in combat. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Spells you cast ignore resistance to lightning and thunder damage.

When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, you can add your proficiency bonus to the damage roll. The damage bonus applies to one damage roll of a spell, not multiple rolls.

sheet.description: Spells you cast ignore resistance to lightning and thunder damage. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, you can add +{{stormadept:prof}} to the damage roll.

element.name: Ruinous Adept
element.prerequisite: The ability to cast at least one spell

description.p: You have mastered the use of acid, necrotic and poison magic in combat. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Spells you cast ignore resistance to acid, necrotic and poison damage.

When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals acid, necrotic, or poison damage, you can add your proficiency bonus to the damage roll. The damage bonus applies to one damage roll of a spell, not multiple rolls.

sheet.description: Spells you cast ignore resistance to acid, necrotic and poison damage. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals acid, necrotic, or poison damage, you can add +{{atrophyadept:prof}} to the damage roll.

element.name: Elemental Adept
element.prerequisite: The ability to cast at least one spell

element.name: Grappler
element.prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher

description.p: Prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher
You’ve developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling.
You can use your action to try to pin a creature grappled by you. To do so, make another grapple check. If you succeed, you and the creature are both restrained until the grapple ends.

sheet.description: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling. You can use your action to try to pin a creature grappled by you. To do so, make another grapple check. If you succeed, you and the creature are both restrained until the grapple ends.

element.name: Heavy Weapon Master
element.prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher

description.p: You’ve learned to put the weight of a weapon to your advantage, letting its momentum empower your strikes.
When wielding a weapon with the versatile or heavy traits that you are proficient with, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: When wielding a versatile weapon in your primary hand, you can use the higher damage die listed even when you're wielding the weapon with one hand.
On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.

Before you make a melee attack with a weapon, you can declare it to be a power attack. The target of the attack may double its Dexterity bonus to AC (if any). If the attack hits, you add +5 to the attack’s damage.

sheet.description: You can use the higher damage die when wieling a versatile weapon one-handed in your primary hand. On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action. You can declare a melee weapon attack to be a power attack. The target of the attack may double its Dexterity bonus to AC (if any). If the attack hits, it deals +5 damage.

element.name: Healer
element.prerequisite: Proficiency in Medicine

description.p: You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: When you use a healer’s kit to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.

As an action, you can spend one use of a healer’s kit to tend to a creature and restore 2d6 hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature’s maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can’t regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can spend one use of a healer’s kit to tend to a creature and restore 2d6 hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature’s maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can’t regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest. When you use a healer’s kit to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.

element.name: Heavily Armored
element.prerequisite: Proficiency with medium armor

description.p: You have trained to master the use of heavy armor, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with heavy armor.

sheet.description: You have trained to master the use of heavy armor.

element.name: Heavy Armor Master
element.prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher, proficiency with heavy armor

description.p: You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You can don and doff heavy armor as if it were medium armor.
While you are wearing heavy armor, you gain resistance to slashing and piercing damage from weapon attacks.

sheet.description: While you are wearing heavy armor, you gain resistance to slashing and piercing damage from weapon attacks. You don and doff heavy armor as if it were medium.

element.name: Inspiring Leader
element.prerequisite: Charisma 13 or higher

description.p: You can spend a bonus action inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier. A creature can’t gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can inspire your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain {{inspiring leader:hp:temp}} temporary hit points. A creature can’t gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest.

description.p: You have a mind that can track time, direction, and detail with uncanny precision. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You always know which way is north.
You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.
You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.

sheet.description: You always know which way is north. You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset. You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.

description.p: You have trained to master the use of light armor, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with light armor.

sheet.description: You have trained to master the use of light armor.

element.name: Light Armor Master
element.prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher, proficiency with light armor

description.p: You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefit:

ul.li: You can sleep in light armor without suffering exhaustion.
While you are wearing light armor, you gain resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage from weapon attacks.

sheet.description: While you are wearing light armor, you gain resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage from weapon attacks. You can sleep in light armor without suffering exhaustion.

description.p: You have studied languages and codes, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You learn three languages of your choice.

You can ably create written ciphers. Others can’t decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus), or they use magic to decipher it.

sheet.description: You can ably create written ciphers. Others can’t decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC {{linguist:dc}}), or they use magic to decipher it.

description.p: You have inexplicable luck that seems to kick in at just the right moment.

You have 3 luck points. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional d20. You can choose to spend one of your luck points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.
You can also spend one luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a d20, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker’s roll or yours.
If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled.
You regain your expended luck points when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional d20. You can choose to spend one of your luck points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You can also spend one luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a d20, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker’s roll or yours.

description.p: You have practiced techniques useful in melee combat against spellcasters, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: When a creature within 5 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.
When you damage a creature that is concentrating on a spell, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its concentration.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of you.

sheet.description: When a creature within 5 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature. When you damage a creature that is concentrating on a spell, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its concentration. You have advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of you.

description.p: Your exposure to the Feywild or one of its denizens has left a magical mark on you. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn the misty step spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the divination or enchantment school of magic. You can cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. You can also cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. The spells’ spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can’t cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest.

Spells you cast through this feat become more powerful as you gain levels. Starting at 5th level, when you cast one of these spells without expending a spell slot, treat the spell as if it's being cast using a 2nd level spell slot. At 11th level, this becomes a 3rd level spell slot, and at 17th level a 4th level spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast each of your chosen spells once without expending a spell slot. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have.
You can cast each of your chosen spells once without expending a spell slot, resolving their effects as if a 2nd level spell slot was used. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have.
You can cast each of your chosen spells once without expending a spell slot, resolving their effects as if a 3rd level spell slot was used. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have.
You can cast each of your chosen spells once without expending a spell slot, resolving their effects as if a 4th level spell slot was used. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have.

description.p: Your soul is touched by the Shadowfell, leaving you with an aptitude for its dark powers. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn the darkness spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the illusion or necromancy school of magic. You can cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. You can also cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. The spells’ spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can’t cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest.

Spells you cast through this feat become more powerful as you gain levels. Starting at 5th level, when you cast one of these spells without expending a spell slot, treat the spell as if it's being cast using a 2nd level spell slot. At 11th level, this becomes a 3rd level spell slot, and at 17th level a 4th level spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast each of your chosen spells once without expending a spell slot. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have.
You can cast each of your chosen spells once without expending a spell slot, resolving their effects as if a 2nd level spell slot was used. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have.
You can cast each of your chosen spells once without expending a spell slot, resolving their effects as if a 3rd level spell slot was used. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have.
You can cast each of your chosen spells once without expending a spell slot, resolving their effects as if a 4th level spell slot was used. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have.

element.name: Arcane Prodigy
element.prerequisite: Intelligence 13 or higher, Charisma 13 or higher

description.p: You have an intuitive grasp of magic that exceeds that of your peers. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You learn two Metamagic options of your choice from the sorcerer class. You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless the option says otherwise.

You gain 4 sorcery points to spend on Metamagic (these points are added to any sorcery points you have from another source but can be used only on Metamagic). You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless the option says otherwise. You gain 4 sorcery points to spend on Metamagic. You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a long rest.

element.name: Student of Magic
element.prerequisite: Intelligence 13 or higher

description.p: You've studied the workings of magic, and gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the wizard’s spell list.

You learn two 1st-level spells from the wizard's spell list. You can cast these spells once each at their lowest level. Once you've cast a spell, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again.

description.p: Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Intelligence.

sheet.description: You learn two cantrips and two 1st-level spells from the wizard list. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Intelligence. You can cast the 1st-level spells once each. Once cast, you must finish a long rest before you can cast such a spell again.

element.name: Arcane Mastery (Bard)
element.prerequisite: Intelligence 15 or higher, proficiency in Arcana

description.p: Though your magic comes naturally, you've studied hard to master its mysteries. You gain the following benefits:
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the bard’s spell list.
In addition, choose two spells from the bard's list of a level that you can cast. You learn those spells, and they do not count towards your maximum number of spells known.
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the bard’s spell list.
In addition, choose two spells from the bard's list of a level that you can cast. You learn those spells, and they do not count towards your maximum number of spells known.
You learn two cantrips of your choice from the cleric’s spell list.
In addition, choose one 1st-level spell from that same list. You learn that spell and can cast it at its lowest level. Once you cast it, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is wisdom.

sheet.description: Spellcasting ability: Wisdom.

description.p: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the druid spell list.
In addition, choose one 1st-level spell from that same list. You learn that spell and can cast it at its lowest level. Once you cast it, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is wisdom.

sheet.description: Spellcasting ability: Wisdom.

element.name: Arcane Mastery (Sorcerer)
element.prerequisite: Intelligence 15 or higher, proficiency in Arcana

description.p: Though your magic comes naturally, you've studied hard to master its mysteries. You gain the following benefits:
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the sorcerer’s spell list.
In addition, choose two spells from the sorcerer's list of a level that you can cast. You learn those spells, and they do not count towards your maximum number of spells known.
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the sorcerer’s spell list.
In addition, choose two spells from the sorcerer's list that of a level you can cast. You learn those spells, and they do not count towards your maximum number of spells known.

element.name: Arcane Mastery (Warlock)
element.prerequisite: Intelligence 15 or higher, proficiency in Arcana

description.p: Though your magic has been gained through your patron, you've studied hard to master its mysteries. You gain the following benefits:
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the warlock’s spell list.
In addition, choose two spells from the warlock's list of a level that you can cast. You learn those spells, and they do not count towards your maximum number of spells known.
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the warlock’s spell list.
In addition, choose two spells from the warlock's list of a level that you can cast. You learn those spells, and they do not count towards your maximum number of spells known.

element.name: Arcane Mastery (Wizard)
element.prerequisite: Intelligence 17 or higher, proficiency in Arcana

description.p: Your curiosity for magic and spellcraft puts other wizards to shame. You gain the following benefits:
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard’s spell list.
In addition, choose four spells from the wizard's list of a level that you can cast. You learn those spells and may add them to your spellbook for free.
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard’s spell list.
In addition, choose four spells from the wizard's list of a level that you can cast. You learn those spells and may add them to your spellbook for free.
You have martial training that allows you to perform special combat maneuvers. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You learn two maneuvers of your choice from among those available to the Battle Master archetype in the fighter class. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver’s effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain three superiority dice, which are d6s (if you already have superiority dice from another source, you gain two additional dice instead). These dice are used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: {{martial adept:dice:amount}}d{{martial adept:dice:size}} superiority dice / short rest. DC {{martial adept:dc}}

element.name: Medium Armor Master
element.prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher, proficiency with medium armor

description.p: You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefit:

ul.li: You can don and doff medium armor as if it were light armor.
While you are wearing medium armor, you gain resistance to bludgeoning and slashing damage from weapon attacks.

sheet.description: While you are wearing medium armor, you gain resistance to bludgeoning and slashing damage from weapon attacks. You can don and doff medium armor as if it were light.

description.p: You are exceptionally speedy and agile. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Your speed increases by 10 feet while wearing light or no armor.
When you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn’t cost you extra movement on that turn.
When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don’t provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

sheet.description: When you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn’t cost you extra movement on that turn. When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don’t provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

element.name: Moderately Armored
element.prerequisite: Proficiency with light armor

description.p: You have trained to master the use of medium armor and shields, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with medium armor and shields.

sheet.description: You have trained to master the use of medium armor and shields.

description.p: You are a dangerous foe to face while mounted. While you are mounted and aren’t incapacitated, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount.
You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead.

If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

sheet.description: You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount. You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead. If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

description.p: Quick to notice details of your environment, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
If you can see a creature’s mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret what it’s saying by reading its lips.
You can take the Search action as a bonus action.

You have learned a number of spells that you can cast as rituals. These spells are written in a ritual book, which you must have on hand while casting one of them. When you choose this feat, you gain the following benefits:
Your Intelligence increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You acquire a ritual book holding two 1st-level spells of your choice. Choose one of the following classes: bard, druid, warlock, or wizard. You must choose your spells from that class’s spell list, and the spells you choose must have the ritual tag. The class you choose also determines your spellcasting ability for these spells: Charisma for bard or warlock; Wisdom for druid; or Intelligence for wizard.

If you come across a spell in written form, such as a magical spell scroll or a wizard’s spellbook, you might be able to add it to your ritual book. The spell must be on the spell list for the class you chose, the spell’s level can be no higher than half your level (rounded up), and it must have the ritual tag. The process of copying the spell into your ritual book takes 2 hours per level of the spell, and costs 10 gp per level. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it.

description.p: You use shields not just for protection but also for offense. You gain the following benefits while you are wielding a shield:

ul.li: If you take the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.
If you aren’t incapacitated, your Dexterity saving throws gain a bonus as if you were in half cover. If you're already in half cover, gain the bonus from three-quarters cover instead.

If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.
